definition: to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in

sentences.english: I have get a paper-clip. Will that do?

sentences.english: They also include plans for clip-on ties.

sentences.english: Rhodium-plated brooch with entwined clear crystal pavé loops.

sentences.english: Or try sliding the pencil close to the heavier clip.
sentences.chinese: 或許可以試着將鉛筆向重的曲別針一邊滑動。

sentences.english: Pin the pieces together before sewing them.

sentences.english: Don't button up brooch on the silk clothing, otherwise leave pinprick easily.

sentences.english: Doctors had fixed it in place with metal pins.

sentences.english: He wore a pearl pin stuck in his black tie.
sentences.chinese: 他那黑領帶上別著一個珍珠別針。

sentences.english: I let her wear my guardian angel pin to help keep her safe.
sentences.chinese: 我讓她戴上了我的保衛天神別針，來包管她的安定。

sentences.english: The letters were held together with a paper clip.

sentences.english: A  brooch fixed to the collar matched her diamond- studded  sapphire button earrings.
